intro: Gomidesia beyrichiana var. acutata, commonly known as the sharp-leaved gomidesia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its lanceolate, serrated leaves and showy, pink to red bracteate flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
